description: A squirrel and a boy set out on a journey together to restore daylight. They must find and release the moon stuck high up on a tree somewhere far, far away.

tags.name: Stop Motion
tags.description: Animation style characterized by physical objects being moved incrementally between frames to create the illusion of movement.

node.description:
[Website](https://tecarat.jp)

Yashiro was born in 1969 in Akita prefecture in Japan and graduated from Tokyo University of the Arts Design Department in 1993. In addition to working at Taiyo Kikaku as a TV commercial director focusing on live action, he has also worked with various methods of stop-motion animation. In 2013, he released his first stop-motion animation for a Dome film, "Norman the Snowman: Aurora in the North Country", and since then, he has worked on "The Moon on a Sleepless Night", The film has won many awards both in Japan and abroad. He established TECARAT in 2015 and switched emphasis to puppet animation. In addition to scriptwriting and directing, he is also involved in art, animation and puppet modeling. He aims to produce images unique to stop-motion animation, emphasizing the texture produced when creating by hand.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanjigram_a) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanjigram_a/)

Born in Saitama prefecture in 1986. After graduating from Musashino Art University's College of Art and Design in 2008, she worked as a stage designer, attended a small school of art animation, and studied under animator Fumiko Magari.
After joining Taiyo Kikaku in 2013, she gained extensive experience in art design, puppet creation, and planning.
She specializes in at drawing out the cuteness and unique characteristics of familiar objects, and works on producing stop-motion animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanjigram_a) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanjigram_a/)
